When my wife told me an all you can eat Japanese restaurant opened up in Vaudreuil I was beyond excited. 

A couple of issues.

1.  They water down the soy sauce which is ridiculous.  I know it's not the cheapest commodity to buy but it's a horrible move. 

2. Service is fair. You order off the iPad, which is fine but the staff are neither friendly or contentious so it's a wash. 

3. The menu is a mix of Japanese and Chinese which could probably satisfy the local market. Not a big fan of this. Sashimi is a 7/10.  Rolls are 7.5/10.  The sushi rice they use is very average. 

It's worth a visit if you have a craving for Japanese but don't expect a huge list of sushi...it's primarily rolls and fried dishes. All this being said, it's still probably your better option for Japanese in the area. 

3 stars

Quick service! That's all that is good about this place...the rice they use for their sushi is absolutely horrible. It is incredibly dry and feels semi cooked. There is really nothing else to say. The variety is there but they don't utilisé it because they use cheap ingredients. I can say for sure I will not be going back. 28$ per person for all you can eat wasted down the drain...
